intro: Melochia varroniifolia, commonly known as the velvetleaf or broadleaf melochia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that are clustered in racemes, which bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Melochia varroniifolia is also known for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional remedies.
